validationRules.style: Required - Must be one of 9 styles: 'style-1' through 'style-9'. Each style has unique separator/layout behavior
validationRules.Title: Required - Main heading text (string). Can be dynamic via WordPress context
validationRules.titleType: Must be valid HTML tag: 'h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6', 'div', 'span', 'p'. Affects SEO and semantic structure
validationRules.subTitleType: Same HTML tag options as titleType for subtitle
validationRules.Alignment: Responsive object with md/sm/xs. Values: 'left', 'center', 'right'. NOT applicable to style-5
validationRules.titleTypo.openTypography: Must be 1 to enable typography controls (fontSize, fontWeight, etc.)
validationRules.titleGrad: Boolean - Set to true to enable gradient text (titleStroke must be set)
validationRules.titleStroke: CSS gradient string (e.g., 'linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%)'). Only when titleGrad:true
validationRules.subTitlePosition: Must be 'onTopTitle' or 'onBottonTitle' to position subtitle above or below main title
validationRules.ETPosition: Must be 'beforeTitle' or 'afterTitle' to position extra title before or after main title
validationRules.limitTgl: Must be true to enable truncation controls (titleLimit, subTitleLimit)
validationRules.titleLimit: Boolean - Enable truncation for main title. Requires limitTgl:true
validationRules.titleLimitOn: Must be 'char' or 'word' for character-based or word-based truncation
validationRules.titleCount: String number (e.g., '50') - how many characters/words to show before truncation
validationRules.titleDots: Boolean - Show ellipsis (...) after truncated text
validationRules.sepColor: Hex color for separator line (applies to style-3, style-4, style-5, style-8)
validationRules.sepWidth: Responsive object (md/sm/xs) with unit (% or px). For separator width in style-3, style-8
validationRules.sepHeight: Responsive object for separator line thickness (style-3)
validationRules.topSepHeight: Responsive object for top separator height (style-4 only)
validationRules.bottomSepHeight: Responsive object for bottom separator height (style-4 only)
validationRules.sepDotColor: Hex color for decorative dots (style-6, style-8)
validationRules.splitType: Must be 'words', 'chars', or 'lines' for animation split behavior
validationRules.anchor: HTML ID string (no spaces, alphanumeric + hyphens/underscores) for anchor links

warnings: ⚠️ titleGrad:true requires titleStroke gradient CSS. Title won't show gradient without valid gradient string
⚠️ Alignment does NOT work with style-5 (specific layout restriction)
⚠️ Separator attributes (sepColor, sepWidth, etc.) only apply to specific styles - check style documentation
⚠️ Text truncation (titleLimit) permanently shortens visible text - only use for dynamic/unknown content lengths
⚠️ titleType affects SEO - use only ONE h1 per page, use h2-h6 hierarchically
⚠️ splitType 'chars' can cause rendering issues with special characters or emojis
⚠️ Animation effects require JavaScript - may not work if JS disabled or in AMP contexts
⚠️ Gradient text (titleGrad) requires modern browsers - fallback to titleColor in older browsers
⚠️ extraTitle appears inline with main title - test responsive wrapping on small screens
⚠️ Very long titleCount values defeat truncation purpose - keep reasonable (< 100 chars)
⚠️ imgName separator image (style-3) should be transparent PNG/SVG, sized 40-80px width
⚠️ titleBg background with titleGrad gradient text may clash - use one or the other
⚠️ Box shadow (titleShadow) only visible when title has background or border
⚠️ Dynamic content via WordPress context requires proper ACF/post setup - won't work outside post context
⚠️ Anchor IDs must be unique per page - duplicate anchors break navigation
commonMistakes: ❌ Setting titleGrad:true but forgetting titleStroke gradient (text becomes invisible)
❌ Forgetting openTypography:1 before setting fontSize/fontWeight (styles don't apply)
❌ Using multiple h1 tags per page (bad for SEO - use h2-h6 for subsections)
❌ Setting Alignment on style-5 (alignment is ignored for this style)
❌ Using titleColor when titleGrad:true (gradient overrides solid color)
❌ Setting limitTgl:false but titleLimit:true (truncation won't work without master toggle)
❌ Using 'char' limit with small titleCount (e.g., '10') making heading unreadable
❌ Not testing extraTitle responsive wrapping (can break layout on mobile)
❌ Setting sepColor for style-1 or style-2 (these styles don't have separators)
❌ Using very complex animations (aniEffect + scale + rotate) causing performance issues
❌ Forgetting to set titleType (defaults to h3, may not match semantic structure)
❌ Using same anchor ID twice on page (breaks anchor link navigation)
❌ Setting titleBRadius without titleBg or titleB (border radius has no visual effect)
❌ Using splitType 'chars' with long headings (creates hundreds of DOM elements, slow rendering)
❌ Not accounting for titleMargin/titlePadd responsive values on small screens
bestPractices: ✅ Use h1 for page title ONLY, h2 for major sections, h3-h6 for subsections (proper heading hierarchy)
✅ Set Alignment responsively: center on desktop, left on mobile for better readability
✅ Use gradient headings (titleGrad) sparingly for emphasis - too many gradients look cluttered
✅ Keep titleCount truncation between 40-80 characters for optimal readability
✅ Use subTitle for context, not as a second main heading (keep it descriptive)
✅ Choose style variant based on section purpose: style-3 for formal, style-6 for elegant, style-1 for flexible
✅ Use extraTitle for badges/labels (NEW, FEATURED, etc.) rather than hacking with pseudo-elements
✅ Set responsive typography: scale down 30-40% on mobile (xs) from desktop (md)
✅ Use animations sparingly - fade/slide are safest, complex animations distract
✅ Provide anchor IDs for important section headings to enable table-of-contents navigation
✅ Use titleDots:true when truncating to clearly indicate hidden text
✅ Match sepColor to brand colors or create visual rhythm across page sections
✅ For long pages, use consistent heading styles (same style variant per section type)
✅ Test gradient text on light AND dark backgrounds - ensure readability
✅ Use titleBg backgrounds for CTA headings to create visual emphasis/separation
✅ Combine heading with tp-pro-paragraph in tp-container for complete section headers
✅ Use style-3 separator width 60-80% on desktop for visual balance
✅ Set subTitleMargin top:16-24px to create breathing room between title and subtitle
✅ Use uppercase text-transform with increased letter-spacing (1-2px) for modern look
✅ For hero headings, use fontSize 48-72px desktop, scale to 28-40px mobile

byCharacter.description: Truncates at exact character count regardless of word breaks
byCharacter.pros: Predictable length, prevents extremely long words
byCharacter.cons: Can cut words mid-character (e.g., 'Busine...' instead of 'Business...')
byCharacter.bestFor: Fixed-width layouts, card grids, strict space constraints

byWord.description: Truncates at word boundaries (shows complete words only)
byWord.pros: More readable, respects natural word breaks
byWord.cons: Final length varies (depends on word lengths), may exceed character target
byWord.bestFor: Content listings, blog titles, general readability

words.description: Splits heading by words - each word animates separately

chars.description: Splits heading by characters - each letter animates separately
chars.performance: Poor for long headings (many DOM elements)
chars.bestFor: Short headings (< 20 chars), dramatic character reveals, logo text

lines.description: Splits heading by lines - each line animates separately
lines.bestFor: Multi-line headings, paragraph-style titles, responsive text

accessibilityNotes: ♿ Use proper heading hierarchy (h1 → h2 → h3) - never skip levels (h1 → h3 is bad)
♿ Ensure heading text is descriptive and meaningful without surrounding context
♿ Provide sufficient color contrast - WCAG AA requires 4.5:1 for small text, 3:1 for large (18px+ or 14px+ bold)
♿ Don't rely solely on color to convey meaning - use text/icons as well
♿ Gradient text may fail contrast checks - verify with color contrast analyzer tools
♿ Anchor IDs enable skip-to-content navigation - provide anchors for major sections
♿ Screen readers announce heading level - use titleType semantically, not for visual size
♿ Avoid very long headings (> 100 chars) - hard for screen readers and cognitive processing
♿ Animations should respect prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query (automatic in modern implementations)
♿ Ensure headings are keyboard focusable when used as anchor links
performanceConsiderations: ⚡ Avoid splitType 'chars' on long headings (creates many DOM elements, increases paint time)
⚡ Use CSS gradients (titleStroke) rather than background images for gradient text (faster rendering)
⚡ Limit complex animations (combined scale + rotate + position) to avoid jank on low-end devices
⚡ Avoid excessive titleShadow blur values (> 20px) which increase paint cost
⚡ Use transform animations (aniEffect) rather than position/margin changes (GPU accelerated)
⚡ Keep imgName separator images under 50KB and sized appropriately (40-80px width)
⚡ Minimize responsive breakpoint values - 2-3 breakpoints (md, xs) usually sufficient
⚡ Avoid very frequent animation delays (< 50ms) which can cause stuttering on slower devices
⚡ Use system fonts or preloaded web fonts - avoid @import in titleTypo.fontFamily
⚡ Truncated headings (titleLimit) reduce DOM text size - good for long dynamic content
